summary: A two-volume homiliary written in s. xiin. Bodley 342, fols 203-18 were added in s. ximed, and they contain Ælfric's homilies for St Andrew, the patron saint of Rochester. The scribe who copied these additional homilies also made numerous alterations and additions between the lines. The manuscript was probably at Rochester in s. xi.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 203r) Sƿa hƿa sƿa sylð anum þurstigum menn | ceald ƿæter on minum naman

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 204v) Mid þam libbað. | ˥rixað. on lichaman ˥on saƿle on eal | ra ƿorulda ƿoruld. ameN

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 204v) [S]imle (no 's' at beginning) est regnum celorum homini pa | tri familias. qui exiit primo mane. | eno 's' at beginning hælend sƿæð þætheofonan rice ƿære | gelic sumum hiredes ealdre. se ðe | ferde on ærnemerien. ˥ ƿolde hyri | an ƿyrhtan into his ƿinearde;

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 206r) sƿa sƿa halford his hired on his eal | le (ends abruptly)

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 206v)II. kalendas. NATALE SANCTI ANDREE. APOSTOLI.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 206v) Ambulans iesus iuxta mare galileae. & reliqua. | Crist on sumere ride ferde ƿið ða galileiscan sæ

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 11v) geornlice gefelle. ˥ healde þurh ðone þe leofað ˥ rixað a buton ænde. AMEN.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 211v) EODEM DIE PASSIO SANCTI ANDREA. APOSTOLI

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 218r) a to ƿiðan feore. (Ends imperfectly. Part of lines on fol. 128 lost because outer part of folio was cut off)

admin: Manuscript described by Takako Kato with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Sanne van der Schee with reference to published scholarship (2010; 2013)
